scott.goal: Schedule a 30-minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits everyone's calendar.

private_information: No meetings on Monday (free all day)
gabriel.goal: Schedule a 30-minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits everyone's calendar.

christine.goal: Schedule a 30-minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits everyone's calendar.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate participants' availabilities and produce a PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownwards planner that yields a valid 30-minute meeting time on Monday for Scott, Gabriel, and Christine.

public_information: Schedule a single 30-minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00.
All provided busy intervals are for the same day (Monday).
There exists at least one time slot that works for all participants.

availability.system_prompt: You are Scott. You are given the public schedule constraints for the meeting day and your personal calendar entries. Provide your available time slots between the work hours on the specified day, excluding your busy intervals. Return the availability as a list of non-overlapping time intervals in 24-hour HH:MM-HH:MM format (for example: 09:00-09:30, 11:00-11:30). Do not produce PDDL.
availability.prompt: Your name is scott. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->scott->private_information}. Goal: {agents->scott->goal}. List all available intervals within the work hours on the given day suitable for a 30-minute meeting.

availability.system_prompt: You are Gabriel. You are given the public schedule constraints for the meeting day and your personal calendar entries. Provide your available time slots between the work hours on the specified day, excluding your busy intervals. Return the availability as a list of non-overlapping time intervals in 24-hour HH:MM-HH:MM format. Do not produce PDDL.
availability.prompt: Your name is gabriel. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->gabriel->private_information}. Goal: {agents->gabriel->goal}. List all available intervals within the work hours on the given day suitable for a 30-minute meeting.

availability.system_prompt: You are Christine. You are given the public schedule constraints for the meeting day and your personal calendar entries. Provide your available time slots between the work hours on the specified day, excluding your busy intervals. Return the availability as a list of non-overlapping time intervals in 24-hour HH:MM-HH:MM format. Do not produce PDDL.
availability.prompt: Your name is christine. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->christine->private_information}. Goal: {agents->christine->goal}. List all available intervals within the work hours on the given day suitable for a 30-minute meeting.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in PDDL modeling and in producing planning problems for the FastDownwards solver. You will receive each participant's availability as lists of time intervals. Integrate these availabilities and build a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that models scheduling a single 30-minute meeting on the given day between 09:00 and 17:00 for the three participants. The planning encoding should make clear the time discretization you use (for example, 30-minute slots) and should ensure the selected meeting start time is within every participant's available intervals. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for FastDownwards. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain>...</domain> and the PDDL problem between <problem>...</problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Inputs: {workflow->orchestrator->pddl->input}. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Participants' availabilities: {availability_scott}, {availability_gabriel}, {availability_christine}. Your goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Think step by step, integrate the availabilities, and produce a PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards planner that yields a valid 30-minute meeting time for all participants. Keep participants' identities distinct in the PDDL encoding.
